title: 109_s1835
content:
The curr_chunk is: "SECTION 1. ROCKY FLATS ENVIRONMENTAL TECHNOLOGY SITE."

The summarized chunk is: "Rocky Flats Environmental Technology Site." The curr_chunk is: 
Definitions in the Act include essential mineral right, fair market value, map, and natural resource damage liability claim. The curr_chunk defines "natural resource damage liability claim" as a claim under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 related to hazardous substances releases at Rocky Flats. "Rocky Flats" refers to the Department of Energy facility in Colorado, and "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Energy. The Secretary of Energy is defined as the Secretary of Energy, and Trustees are Federal and State officials designated under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. The Secretary can purchase essential mineral rights at Rocky Flats within a year of the Act's enactment, provided the owner is willing to sell. The Secretary can purchase essential mineral rights at Rocky Flats within a year of the Act's enactment for fair market value. Funds under subsection (c) are limited for this purpose. Any natural resource damage liability claim can be satisfied by the Secretary purchasing mineral rights for $10,000,000, paying Trustees $10,000,000, or purchasing a portion of the mineral rights. The Secretary can purchase mineral rights at Rocky Flats for less than $10,000,000, with the Trustees receiving the difference. Funds received must be used for environmental purposes as per the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. The Trustees can use funds for environmental purposes, including purchasing mineral rights and developing habitat restoration projects at Rocky Flats. Expenditures must be made jointly, and funds can be used in conjunction with other private and public funds. Purchases of mineral rights are exempt from the National Environmental Policy Act. Management responsibilities at Rocky Flats National Wildlife Refuge can be transferred. The Rocky Flats National Wildlife Refuge Act of 2001 is amended to transfer management responsibilities and adjust boundaries. The Rocky Flats National Wildlife Refuge Act of 2001 (Public Law 107-107) is amended to adjust boundaries, specifying the composition of the refuge within Rocky Flats. Land excluded for Department of Energy response actions is not part of the refuge. The Rocky Flats National Wildlife Refuge Act of 2001 is amended to adjust boundaries, specifying the composition of the refuge within Rocky Flats. Essential mineral rights over certain land are subject to Secretary's jurisdiction until purchased or reclaimed by mineral rights holders according to Colorado's requirements. The Rocky Flats National Wildlife Refuge Act of 2001 is amended to adjust boundaries, specifying the composition of the refuge within Rocky Flats. Essential mineral rights over certain land are subject to Secretary's jurisdiction until purchased or reclaimed by mineral rights holders in accordance with Colorado's requirements. Upon acquisition of the mineral rights or land reclamation, the Secretary shall transfer the land to the Secretary of the Interior for inclusion in the refuge, who will manage it accordingly. The Rocky Flats National Wildlife Refuge Act of 2001 is amended to adjust boundaries and specify the composition of the refuge within Rocky Flats. $10,000,000 from the authorized appropriations for fiscal year 2006 shall be made available to the Secretary for specified purposes.
